title: Claudio Ranieri has offers Chinese Super League but wants to take over at Fiorentina if Paulo Sousa moves to Juventus
text:
EFL every claud Claudio Ranieri has offers Chinese Super League but wants to take over at Fiorentina if Paulo Sousa moves to Juventus 
Sacked Leicester boss wants to stay in Europe — and has success managing La Viola, winning first major honours Exclusive Comments CLAUDIO RANIERI could soon be given a route back into management — at one of his former clubs. 6 Claudio Ranieri was sacked as Leicester manager, but is not short on interest 
He won the Premier League Manager of the Season, LMA Manager of the Year, Italian Manager of the Year and ‘The Best’ Fifa Football Coach in an unforgettable 2016. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Fiorentina news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
And his achievements have not gone unnoticed. 
Ranieri could be set for a return to Fiorentina in the summer — while, he also has offers from various Chinese Super League clubs on the table. 
However, the 65-year-old still wants to manage in one of Europe’s top leagues. 
La Viola have endured a disappointing season, which was emphasised by their calamitous exit from the Europa League . A 1-0 win at Borussia Monchengladbach had put them in control of the tie — and qualification looked certain when they took an early 2-0 lead in the second leg at the Stadio Artemio Franchi. 
However, a second-half collapse saw them concede four times and their European adventure came to an abrupt end. 
Ranieri took over as manager of the Tuscan giants in 1993 when they were in Italy’s second tier and, with the likes of Gabriel Batistuta in their ranks, helped the club achieve promotion. 
He also won his first major trophies with Coppa Italia and Italian Super Cup success in 1996. AP:Associated Press Captain Gabriel Batistuta with the Italian Super Cup won under Claudio Ranieri in 1996 Getty Images 6 Former Juventus midfielder, Paulo Sousa, could leave Fiorentina for the Bianconeri 
Fiorentina boss Paulo Sousa will leave at the end of the season, and is expected to take over as manager of Juventus , with Max Allegri likely to end his three-year spell at the club. 
And possibly replace Arsene Wenger at Arsenal . 
Sousa is a former Juventus player and won the Champions League with the Bianconeri in 1996. Tony Cottee speaks on the shock of Leicester City sacking manager Claudio Ranieri
